paper_abstract: We develop a variant of a Bloom filter that is robust to hardware failure and show how it can be used as an efficient associative memory. We define a measure of the information recall and show that our new associative memory is able to recall more than twice as much information as a Hopfield network. The extra efficiency of our associative memory is all the more remarkable as it uses only bits while the Hopfield network uses integers.
paper_title: Efficient and robust associative memory from a generalized Bloom filter
